data.title: L.A. Noire Crunch Culture, Bondi issues, RockStar Boss chimes in #NoCakeDay
data.meta_description: With the RDR2 100-hours/week controvery growing bigger and bigger, more devs are using this occasion to talk about their own experiences in the industry...
data.text:
With the RDR2 100-hours/week controvery growing bigger and bigger, more devs are using this occasion to talk about their own experiences in the industry, but one of them is particularly striking since it also concerns a Rockstar published game that wasn't reported before:

https://twitter.com/JennSandercock/status/1052252298070581249

rock star can fuck off

i'm not getting red dead 2 because of their labour practices

(maybe i'll get it used one day or on a deep discount)

but one of them is particularly striking since it also concerns a Rockstar published game that wasn't reported before

The working conditions at Team Bondi were pretty notorious after the release of the game.

Brendan McNamara, boss of LA Noire developers Team Bondi, thinks it's totally reasonable for his staff to be "killing themselves" with long hours because that's what this business is about.

https://kotaku.com/5818019/report-l...ll-rockstar-no-longer-working-with-team-bondi

https://kotaku.com/5816507/la-noires-studio-under-investigation-over-alleged-shonky-work-practices

Some people watch other people no being "productive" for 15 minutes and start scratching their arms like mad.

Fine, go, go make people feel like they work in a prison so they can be productive all the time while using facebook and youtube in secrecy and being totally not proactive at all because, why bother?

We knew about the management of Team Bondi, but not the implication of Rockstar in this.

I've heard that QA testers trying to communicate certain bugs they found to devs is a challenge a lot of the time. I can't image how crazy or frustrating it gets when a studio is in crunch.

Really puts things into perspective. The industry needs to figure something out.
